body_html:
@soumith , excuse me if there have been other discussion that I'm not aware of. But how could pytorch project accept amd gpu support? On the one hand I understand the desire to still allow pure CUDA without any intermediate libraries. On the other hand doing sed during build time appears very fragile to me. Also I don't see how pure CUDA would ever support amd gpus. Then only other option seems to be to choose code path during build time but this would duplicate a lot of code increasing maintenance cost.

Again, please let me know if things have already been figured out. Would appreciate any thoughts you can provide.

body:
@soumith , excuse me if there have been other discussion that I'm not aware of. But how could pytorch project accept amd gpu support? On the one hand I understand the desire to still allow pure CUDA without any intermediate libraries. On the other hand doing `sed` during build time appears very fragile to me. Also I don't see how pure CUDA would ever support amd gpus. Then only other option seems to be to choose code path during build time but this would duplicate a lot of code increasing maintenance cost.

Again, please let me know if things have already been figured out. Would appreciate any thoughts you can provide.
